oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ridge planting of maize shows promising yield increase
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Henriksen, Christian Bugge
Rasmussen, Jesper
Jørgensen, Martin Heide
Thomsen, Henning Carlo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pasture and forage crops
Farming Systems
Soil tillage
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ridge planting of maize dramatically increased yield on both sand and sandy loam in 2003-2004. The yield increase was up to 60%. Ridge planting also shows promising results in protein crops such as faba bean and soybean and is currently being tested in winter rape.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Henriksen, Christian Bugge; Rasmussen, Jesper; Jørgensen, Martin Heide and Thomsen, Henning Carlo (2005) Ridge planting of maize shows promising yield increase. DARCOFenews.
